note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
tagline: Simple UI for making symbolic links on Windows
name: mklinkUI - How-To
body:
### How to use mklinkUI
This page shows how to use mklinkUI with Battlefield 3 as an example.

Start _mklinkUI.exe_ and grant it administrative privileges.
![1](http://i1320.photobucket.com/albums/u535/EClaesson/1_zpsc5860876.png)

Click the top _Browse..._ button and select the folder you wish to move and click _OK_.
![2](http://i1320.photobucket.com/albums/u535/EClaesson/2_zpsd08dda01.png)

Click the second _Browse..._ button and select the folder you want to move it to (you can create a new) and click _OK_.
![3](http://i1320.photobucket.com/albums/u535/EClaesson/3_zps3005d99f.png)

Click _Move & Create Link_ and you're done.
![4](http://i1320.photobucket.com/albums/u535/EClaesson/4_zps04ef1438.png)
